unnormalised: **EV Charging Heats Up, Just in Time for Diwali!**
normalised: **E V Charging Heats Up, Just in Time for Diwali!**

unnormalised: Bangalore's buzzing about the latest EV charging developments, and it's perfect timing with Diwali just around the corner! Forget those last-minute petrol runs – this year, electric might just be the way to go for visiting family in Mysore.
normalised: Bengaluru's buzzing about the latest E V charging developments, and it's perfect timing with Diwali just around the corner! Forget those last-minute petrol runs – this year, electric might just be the way to go for visiting family in Mysuru.

unnormalised: Ola Electric just announced a massive expansion of their Hypercharger network, aiming for over 10,000 charging points across India by next year. That's a lot of juice!
normalised: Ola Electric just announced a massive expansion of their Hypercharger network, aiming for over ten thousand charging points across India by next year. That's a lot of juice!

unnormalised: Meanwhile, IIT Madras is working on some seriously cool fast-charging tech that could potentially charge your Tata Nexon EV in under 30 minutes. Imagine that – quicker than ordering biryani on Swiggy!
normalised: Meanwhile, I I T Madras is working on some seriously cool fast-charging tech that could potentially charge your Tata Nexon E V in under thirty minutes. Imagine that – quicker than ordering biryani on Swiggy!

unnormalised: But it's not all sunshine and roses. Concerns remain about the availability of chargers in smaller towns and villages. Charging infrastructure needs to catch up if EVs are truly going to become mainstream, especially for long road trips like visiting Kerala during Onam.
normalised: But it's not all sunshine and roses. Concerns remain about the availability of chargers in smaller towns and villages. Charging infrastructure needs to catch up if E Vs are truly going to become mainstream, especially for long road trips like visiting Kerala during Onam.

unnormalised: Tata Power also plans to install 500 EV chargers in Mumbai within the next 6 months. Cost per unit is still a concern, hovering around Rs. 15-20, but competition is fierce. With range anxiety slowly becoming a thing of the past, the future looks electric, folks!
normalised: Tata Power also plans to install five hundred E V chargers in Mumbai within the next six months. Cost per unit is still a concern, hovering around rupees fifteen to twenty, but competition is fierce. With range anxiety slowly becoming a thing of the past, the future looks electric, folks!
